contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=July 2009}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Zlatko Yankov<br/><small>Златко Янков</small> | image =<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Zlatko Yankov.jpg|200px]] --> | fullname = Zlatko Yankov | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1966|6|7|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Burgas]], [[Bulgaria]] | height = {{height|m=1.84}} | position = [[Midfielder (football)|Defensive midfielder]] (retired) | currentclub = | years1 = 1984–1987 | years2 = 1987–1990 | years3 = 1990–1992 | years4 = 1992 | years5 = 1992–1995 | years6 = 1995–1996 | years7 = 1996–1998 | years8 = 1998–1999 | years9 = 1999 | years10 = 1999–2000 | years11 = 2000 | years12 = 2000 | years13 = 2000–2001 | years14 =2001–2002 | clubs1 = [[PFC Neftochimic Burgas|Neftochimic Burgas]] | clubs2 = [[PFC Chernomorets Burgas|Chernomorets Burgas]] | clubs3 = [[Levski Sofia|Levski]] | clubs4 = [[Real Valladolid]] | clubs5 = [[Levski Sofia|Levski]] | clubs6 = [[KFC Uerdingen]] | clubs7 = [[Beşiktaş JK|Beşiktaş]] | clubs8 = [[Adanaspor]] | clubs9 = [[PFC Neftochimic Burgas|Neftochimic Burgas]] | clubs10 = [[Lokomotiv Sofia]] | clubs11 = [[Vanspor]] | clubs12 = [[Genclerbirligi]] | clubs13 = [[PSFC Chernomorets Burgas|Chernomorets Burgas]] | clubs14 =[[PFC Naftex Burgas|Naftex Burgas]] | caps1 = 107 | goals1 = 11 | caps2 = 88 | goals2 = 8 | caps3 = 58 | goals3 = 3 | caps4 = 6 | goals4 = 1 | caps5 = 70 | goals5 = 14 | caps6 = 15 | goals6 = 1 | caps7 = 61 | goals7 = 3 | caps8 = 7 | goals8 = 1 | caps9 = 13 | goals9 = 1 | caps10 = 7 | goals10 = 0 | caps11 = 6 | goals11 = 1 | caps12 = 9 | goals12 = 1 | caps13 = 15 | goals13 = 3 | caps14 = 24 | goals14 = 1 | totalcaps = 486 | totalgoals = 49 | nationalyears1 = 1990–1999 | nationalteam1 = {{nft|Bulgaria}} | nationalcaps1= 80 | nationalgoals1 = 4 }} '''Zlatko Yankov''' ({{lang-bg|Златко Янков}}) (born 7 June 1966 in [[Burgas]]) is a former [[Bulgaria]]n football midfielder. He was capped 80 times and scored 4 goals for the [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgarian national team]] between 1989 and 1999. He played eight games at the World Cups in [[1994 FIFA World Cup|1994]] and [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998]], and he was also in the Bulgarian [[1996 UEFA European Championship|Euro 1996]] squad.<ref>http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/yankov-intl.html</ref> Currently working as a sport-technical director in [[PFC Chernomorets Burgas]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Bulgaria Squad 1994 World Cup}} {{Bulgaria Squad 1996 UEFA Euro}} {{Bulgaria Squad 1998 World Cup}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Yankov, Zlatko | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Златко Янков | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Bulgarian footballer | DATE OF BIRTH = 7 June 1966 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Burgas, Bulgaria | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yankov, Zlatko}} [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Bulgarian footballers]] [[Category:Real Valladolid footballers]] [[Category:La Liga footballers]] [[Category:1994 FIFA World Cup players]] [[Category:1998 FIFA World Cup players]] [[Category:UEFA Euro 1996 players]] [[Category:Bulgaria international footballers]] [[Category:Neftochimic Burgas players]] [[Category:PFC Chernomorets Burgas players]] [[Category:KFC Uerdingen 05 players]] [[Category:PFC Levski Sofia players]] [[Category:PFC Lokomotiv Sofia players]] [[Category:Gençlerbirliği S.K. footballers]] [[Category:Beşiktaş J.K. footballers]] [[Category:Adanaspor footballers]] [[Category:Vanspor footballers]] [[Category:Bulgarian A Professional Football Group players]] [[Category:Süper Lig players]] [[Category:Bundesliga players]] [[Category:Bulgarian expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Turkey]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Germany]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Spain]] [[Category:People from Burgas]]
